file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 21-27-00-04 - BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT VENTILATION SYSTEM - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT VENTILATION SYSTEM - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to deactivate and reactivate the baggage-compartment ventilation system. B. The baggage-compartment ventilation system has a baggage compartment fan which draws air from the baggage compartment and discharges it in the rear electronic compartment. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT VENTILA- ALL 21-27-00-040-801-A TION SYSTEM - DEACTIVATION PROCE- DURES BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT VENTILA- ALL 21-27-00-440-801-A TION SYSTEM - REACTIVATION PROCE- DURES EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 21-27-00 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-27-00-040-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT VENTILATION SYSTEM - DEACTIVATION PROCEDURES A. General (1) It is permitted to dispatch the airplane with the baggage-compartment ventilation system inoperative, if: • baggage-compartment ventilation system stays closed. • live animals are not carried in the cargo compartment. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM 21-27-00/101 - AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Rear fuselage I D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In rear fuselage I I. Baggage-Compartment Ventilation System - Deactivation Procedure SUBTASK 040-002-A (1) Deactivate Baggage-Compartment Recirculation Fan as follows: (a) On the circuit breaker panel, open the BAGGAGE RECIRC FAN circuit breaker (Location tip: DC BUS 2 / MISCELLANEOUS / BAGGAGE / RECIRC FAN) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 21-27-00 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (b) Open rear electronic compartment access door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). Get access to the rear electronic compartment and find the baggage-compartment recirculation fan (AMM 21-27-00/101). (c) Disconnect and stow the fan electrical connector. (d) Close rear electronic compartment access door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (e) On the circuit breaker panel, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the BAGGAGE RECIRC FAN circuit breaker and close it (Location tip: DC BUS 2 / MISCELLANEOUS / BAGGAGE / RECIRC FAN). (2) An alternative method to deactivate the baggage-compartment recirculation fan is to open the BAGGAGE RECIRC FAN circuit breaker (Location tip: DC BUS 2 / MISCELLANEOUS / BAGGAGE / RECIRC FAN) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (3) Write in the aircraft technical logbook that you did the deactivation procedure for the Baggage-Compartment Ventilation System. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 21-27-00 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-27-00-440-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT VENTILATION SYSTEM - REACTIVATION PROCEDURES A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to reactivate the Baggage-Compartment Ventilation System. (2) This task refers to item 21-27-00 - Baggage-Compartment Ventilation System - of DDPM. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM 21-27-00/101 - AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Rear fuselage I D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In rear fuselage I I. Baggage-Compartment Ventilation System - Reactivation Procedure SUBTASK 440-002-A (1) Do the troubleshooting and the applicable corrective maintenance procedures for the Baggage-Compartment Ventilation or the component that could possibly cause its deactivation. (2) If the Baggage-Compartment Ventilation was deactivated by fan disconnection, do as follows: (a) On the circuit breaker panel, open the BAGGAGE RECIRC FAN circuit breaker (Location tip: DC BUS 2 / MISCELLANEOUS / BAGGAGE / RECIRC FAN) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 440-801-A/400 21-27-00 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (b) Open rear electronic compartment access door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). Get access to the rear electronic compartment and find the baggage-compartment recirculation fan (AMM 21-27-00/101). (c) Reconnect the fan electrical connector. (d) Close rear electronic compartment access door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (e) On the circuit breaker panel, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the BAGGAGE RECIRC FAN circuit breaker and close it (Location tip: DC BUS 2 / MISCELLANEOUS / BAGGAGE / RECIRC FAN). (3) If the Baggage-Compartment Ventilation was deactivated by the alternative method, close the BAGGAGE RECIRC FAN circuit breaker (Location tip: DC BUS 2 / MISCELLANEOUS / BAGGAGE / RECIRC FAN) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 440-801-A/400 21-27-00 Page 5 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
